intro: Linanthus watsonii subsp. laccolithicus, commonly known as the laccolithic flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
